page.title: 17Shopping.
page.content: In Sywell, there is only one shop although the village is visited by many mobile trade vans and door-to-door sales persons. The shop opens at 9.00am and closes at 5.30pm. The shop is used by the local community for much of their shopping but the majority of people only buy bits and pieces. Some people go to the nearby towns of Northampton or Wellingborough but mostly to Weston Favell where there is an undercover precinct to include a Tesco supermarket, various small shops, banks etc., trade stands, a library, a health centre and a sports centre with a swimming pool and where there is ample free parking. At Sywell Superette, it is possible to buy frozen, tinned and fresh food including meat, fruit and vegetables. It is also possible to buy toys and clothes, greetings cards, wines etc..
